place_description:
A Cause for Tea is a collaborative fundraising effort for New Life Nicaragua, HELP Pregnancy Resource Center, and other non-profit organizations that work to meet the needs of and empower women and children.
We are a close-knit team of humanitarians and artists working with local leaders, community members, and non-profit organizations to train and advocate for women and children, develop them for successful and influential integration into their communities with a vision for self-empowerment in order to escape poverty and to bring relief to suffering from malnutrition, lack of shelter, clothing, and education.

reviews_data.review_text: A very sweet place!

I've made many visits to A Cause for Tea and never have been disappointed. Such a pleasant staff and delicious selections from extensive menu. The gift shop has something for everyone. The decor is simply charming.If you want a very happy experience go to A Cause for Tea.
Chicken. Salad. Croissant.
Good
Such a cute spot, so glad I found this tea shop! The decor inside is absolutely adorable, and I love the staff and super kind waitresses! Tea was wonderful!

Very delicious and the service was excellent! It can be a little crowded depending on the time you arrive, but it's well worth the wait. The atmosphere is very charming, and there's a wide selection of teas, small bakery items, and meals.

The food was delicious, and the tea was amazing. I just wish the service was a bit faster. We were there on a Saturday at noon and waiting for around 15 minutes for our server to come with the water. Other than that, we will definitely be back

Any day is a great cause for tea! Absolutely LOVED this place. I sat outside on the front porch and had the loveliest brunch ever.
- I had a new day and it was so good I drank the entire pot to myself. I also order the deviled egg flight and it was beyond delicious.
- I also ordered the chicken pot pie and it was a solid 10/10. Every ingredient tasted so fresh.
- yes, I know I ordered a lot but I also ordered the pasta salad and JEZZ was it good. Once again everything tasted so fresh.

Once I was done eating I walked in the back where they have the cutest gift shop and bakery.  

This place is an inspiration to any person wanting to open local business. I will tell all my friends about this place and be back years to come!
Cute little local place didn't enjoy my sandwich didn't taste so great but as far as the dessert, it was absolutely delicious
Very nice place
Love, Jonna was the best!!

Every time I go to "A Cause for Tea", I come away feeling blessed to have the opportunity to dine & shop in a place like this in my hometown! The food is always delicious & served beautifully by kind, thoughtful servers. The gift shop is filled will all sorts of lovely things & knowing that what you spend helps such a great cause is such a blessing!
Fun place for our ladies gathering and great food.

I absolutely LOVED  my foggy Provence! (Provence is a caffeine free Rooibos based tea with notes of lavender.) Finally, after waiting what seems like half a lifetime, I can order a foggy tea with dairy free options! It was the most phenomenally delicious dairy-free caffeine-free luxury tea with frothy oat milk I've ever had.

I had been wanting to visit A Cause for Tea since last November and I finally was able to visit today. This historic mansion and her interior decor feels like Southern meets British! I really enjoyed their gift shop. Also the food that other tables ordered looks great too! Highly recommend

It's always a wonderful experience when we can get in. Some days it's just so busy, that speaks volumes in itself. It was Valentine's Day and I took my mom and granddaughter to celebrate my mom's birthday and my granddaughter as my Valentine. Sweet time together and wonderful food and atmosphere

Charming house, tasty patisserie choices, delicious menu variety, a lovely gift shop, and very gracious staff. Superb tea selection (with options for how served), and freshly prepared foods.

It was nice that we didn't have to have reservations, as we had a lengthy drive to reach the location. (But so worth the drive.) Already planning our next visit!

Brought a family member here for their birthday (party of 8 total). We did wait an hour for a table on a Saturday afternoon. So be aware this place is popular. Their parking lot was totally full. There are only one or two seats inside for a large party so that's a negative for groups. There are lots of smaller tables. Our lunch was delicious and we loved our tea choices as well. We all want to find a little less busy time to go back again. They had a couple rooms devoted to really cute gift shop items as well. Super charming inside. Everyone loved it!

Arrived at about 9; 30 on a rainy Saturday morning and the place was packed.  They offer a full menu of tea with the description of each. They also have a lovely brunch menu on the weekends, plus a shorter menu during the week.  I enjoyed a cherry almond tea with a chicken and waffle dish plus a blueberry scone.  I usually always get the chicken salad which is fabulous. However, since we went so early in the morning I wanted more of a breakfast item.

Absolutely love A Cause for Tea and recommend for all tea lovers. They have wonderful meals, snacks, and accommodations for kiddos (who don't like tea). Can't say enough good things about this place. On rotation for me and my girlfriends.

What a beautiful house! Allie took good care of us and was very nice.  The Provence tea was delicious, the presentation of everything was great, and the sandwiches were perfect with the tea. Hughly recommend!
A wonderful experience! You'll enjoy every minute!

Love this place. It's truly one of a kind, that takes you back in time. I've brought so many friends and guests here. And everyone enjoys it. Very happy that they have a couple gluten free food & dessert options (would love to see more gluten free savory items pls). The atmosphere/decorations are great, and gift shop is fun to explore.

Everything is quite good, but we especially like their beef pot pie, pea salad, & lavender macarons. Highly recommend their peaches & cream tea, with steamed milk.

Cons: The wait times are long, so prepare to wait 30-45mins on a Saturday. I wish they were open past 5pm during the week.

Walked in right at 9am and seated right away. Great service. Tea was lovely. Avocado toast tasty. The chicken salad was almost great-- one improv, as I added some arugula from the avocado toast, since the sandwich lacked color/texture to balance the chicken salad.

What a special experience. From the friendly hostess stand to the delightful decor even our server rose was perfect. The food was tasteful and I've never had tea taste so delicious. What an amazing place.

Showed up on Wednesday the 8th with a friend from out of town. Met another couple of ladies in the parking lot who were excited too, only to find out you are closed. Nothing on your website about being closed today. Please update website when closing. So disappointed.
Very enjoyable experience! Beautiful place,  great service and excellent food!   Absolutely recommend!
Lovely place, great service, delicious tea and food.

Came to A Cause For Tea the other morning for the first time. Definitely will be returning my server Jayla was amazing. She was very attentive and friendly. She recommended the soup so I decided to try it. One of the best french onion soups I've had. I got the foggy chai to drink and it was DELICIOUS!

The place is cute and worth a visit, so I'm giving it 3 stars.
However, we waited 3 hours (party of 3 + 1 infant), and despite trying to call ahead to check the wait time, no one answered. Since we had driven 50 minutes for the experience, we decided to wait. The boutique was charming and well-decorated, which helped pass the time.

When we finally got a table, we ordered the baked Brie we'd been looking forward to, only to be told they were out (at 2 PM on a Saturday). Disappointing. We ended up with the kids' ham & cheese sandwich, avocado toast with poached egg, broccoli cheddar soup, and savory biscuits. The food was okay but not remarkable.

For tea and desserts, the experience fell apart. The server left our meal dishes on the table, forcing us to stack tea and desserts on top of them. I eventually had to move the dishes to a nearby table myself because who likes the smell of broccoli cheddar soup when you eat a brownie ?!
The teapot leaked boiling water as it was placed on the table, and the hot chocolate for our toddler arrived fridge-cold. When we asked for it to be warmed, the server initially refused, then reluctantly brought back a boiling, water-based version without warning us of how hot it was, resulting in our toddler burning his tongue, which is still sore 24 hours later!!!

The macaron was dry and too cold, the brownie was also dry, but the pecan bar was decent.

Overall, it was a disappointing experience, and we won't return.
Great selection of teas, superb food, wonderful service, all in a delightful and historic setting. Loads of atmosphere, plus an on-site gift shop.
A very nice place for a pot of tea and some light lunch. The service and atmosphere are top notch.

Very nice plase to share a moment with friends with a cup of tea. This is a must visit in Monroe NC
Our server Rose, was awesome, very kind and gentle. The only thing is that is small place and have to wait more than 1 hour. But was worthy!!

Mi hermana que vive en Monroe me llevo a este hermoso lugar, las senoritas muy amables dandome la bienvenida en espanol, el te estaba delicioso al igual que los sandwiches y el postre ni se diga, lo recomiendo ampliamente.
Saluditos desde Reynosa Tamps. Mexico.

Highly recommend sharing this charming & magical place! This was my first visit and I'll definitely be back! Great place to share with your daughters, Moms, Grandmothers, &  girlfriends. Plus ALL proceeds go to a fabulous cause!
Love this place, though the service was really slow last time I went which wouldn't bother me much except we sat outside and it was cold. Other than that, I highly recommend it
Absolutely lovely house with a great staff. Looks like a Hallmark movie.
Absolutely lovely!  My daughter took me to the Christmas Tea and it was wonderful.
The German Gingerbread tea and maple pecan scones were amazing. Great service and such a cute vibe.

My daughter decided to have her birthday party here with her friends! She had an amazing day, the place is beautiful and the people so kind and prompt to help you! From the first phone call to the big day! Thank you so much for making her day special.
Oh this is such a cute place! The staff is super sweet, they have amazing tea choices, and great dishes to enjoy. I will be back!
Best food I've had in a long time
I went here with several family members and the food and tea were great!
Such a cute unique experience in monroe!! we need more places like this!

People would come just to step foot in this beautifully restored mansion. They would come just for the AMAZING food and tea. They would come just for the fantastic service. They would come just for the causes this business supports. Cause For Tea truly has it ALL! Exceeds my expectations every time.
Great food. Beautiful house. Sweet servers.

A week ago was my first time there. I loved everything about it! The decor! The plates. The Napkins. Make sure that you go hungry! I bought a cute little pair of earrings in the gift shop.  Planning a gathering of friends for my birthday next month!

I went yesterday with my daughter, we waited 45 minutes and our waitress never attend us. She attended all the tables around but not ours, we asked her several times if she could take our order and she said she was busy, but would be shortly with us, she never stopped at our table. We had to leave.
AN ABSOLUTE GEM

Very cute place. However the ordering process is overwhelming and unpleasant. There isn't enough space for wit staff to run around while I'm trying to get through. The food was ok and the tea was okay too. Nothing great. But I did not like my chicken waffle thing
The food is very good with ample portions and a great variety. The staff is very friendly and efficient.

#3rd time back here! You know it must be good! I love their "tea" for lunch. Finger sandwiches that are so delicious. Wonderful service and a great gift shop! I am sure I will be back soon!

This is one of my favorite places, especially since it is a tea room and is for a good cause. It has everything you could want in a Tea Room from flaky Scones to little sandwiches and a plethora of other yummy options such as Chicken Pot Pie, Quiche and a Picnic Basket of different kinds of scone sandwiches. I loved the gooey baked brie cheese with flaky crust and blueberry scone I had. The truffle was like a reeses cup only much better - sweet and smooth. Good atmosphere too! Unfortunately the service was a bit slow, but we will definitely come back, it was a busy day for them.

Came here with a group of girlfriends. The service was lovely, the house is beautiful and well decorated. It also smelled like fresh cut flowers (likely bc there were fresh flowers everywhere). A+ for both of those things. The food, however, not great. So many sweets, and with the tea, I felt sick leaving. There were no Savory options to cut through the sugar. Definitely room for improvement there. And none of the treats were memorable, outside of a very dry Cupcake.

So unique and beautiful cafe! There is a store with some cute items for your home such as books , decor , kitchen utensils and other stuff. They also sell tea in beautiful packages and you can give it to someone as a gift. Lovely! The food is great. Big size plates and very reasonable prices. It's pretty busy at 12 noon but there is plenty of space inside and outside. Patio is so cute! I'm so impressed with interior design !
Just loved it!
Omg amazing! Great food and Bakery Goods,  The decor is perfect,  Great cause and gift shop. Will highly recommend to others. We drove 2.5 hours and was well worth the trip! Xoxo Thank you.
Went there today with friends and our daughters and just had the best time. Food was delicious! Service was SO nice and prices were reasonable. Such a cute tea place, definitely coming back
We love coming here. It is definitely beautiful place and the food is absolute delish. The Teas are so good. And i am not a huge tea drinker.
We had a wonderful time celebrating my mother's birthday at A Cause for Tea.  The house is beautiful and the food was delicious!  We loved the Hummingbird Cake!
Great place to dress up for and enjoy good food with good friends. Love the gift shop too! Very quaint & personal.

I took my mom here for her birthday and we had an AMAZING time. Every single thing is so well thought out. The seating, atmosphere, and customer service is amazing. The tea is the best I've ever had. The food was very high quality, lots of flavor, and beautifully presented. They also had lots of gluten free options that were delicious!
I would recommend this place to anyone, we will absolutely be back.

I had a wonderful first experience at A Cause for Tea.  We had the Perfect Combination of a sweets plate with a pot of Peaches and Cream tea.  I had the chicken salad croissant (large portion) and my daughter had the Charming Chicken Pie.  Every single thing was delicious.  The service was great and the entire staff so nice.

The ordering process was a counter style setup that was a bit confusing due to the time of day and rather limited space slotted to the area.

I ordered "tea and scones" a fairly common order for a "tea room".  The scones were quite large and rather bland in flavor.

I was expecting a small pot of tea but received a large "soup cup" of tea with two tea bags in the cup.

Once the food was delivered we did not see a waitress for the rest of the meal. I ended up never getting the refill of hot water I wanted and after 20 or so minutes was able to chase down an attendant to obtain a box to take one of my scones home.

Overall a very nice place that could be a real gem if managed properly.
Rushed us not could have been more friendly considering the prices!
Really well run tea house with ample parking. The atmosphere is southern and adorable. The food is fresh and scrumptious. We can't wait to go back!
This establishment is truly great.My wife and I went there for lunch and it was really good.Located in a beautiful historical home the atmosphere is exceptional along with service.Monroe has a gem!

1st time there. The place was beautiful. Atmosphere was nice, calm, we could have sat on the porch all afternoon. The house, the vintage China, using vintage handkerchiefs as napkins. The food and desserts were really good. The chicken pot pie was amazing. I had 2 teas, iced chai and a cup of hot earl gray, both very good.The staff was really friendly. The chocolate cake and the lemon tart were both delicious. They were quick to response and replaced the piece of cake I had, since there were egg shells in the cake. We will definitely be back since we already know what we are going to order. The only thing is that I  wished the staff came to the table to take our orders. The room where you have to go to order your food is very small  and when you exit the room you go right into a dining room and when it is crowded it hard to maneuver around. Also, it is better to order and dessert all at one time.

If you're seeking a spot where dessert dreams come true and tea time is elevated to an art form, look no further than Decadent Desserts and Tasty Tea. Nestled in the heart of the city, this charming establishment offers a delightful escape for those with a sweet tooth and an appreciation for fine tea.

The dessert menu is nothing short of extraordinary. From rich, velvety chocolate mousse to perfectly flaky pastries, every item is a testament to the chef's expertise and passion. The standout, however, is the triple-layered caramel cake--a heavenly combination of buttery layers and luscious caramel that melts in your mouth.

Complementing these indulgent treats is a carefully curated tea selection. Each blend is chosen for its unique flavor profile and quality, providing a perfect pairing for the desserts. The Earl Grey is a classic, with a fragrant hint of bergamot, while the jasmine tea offers a delicate floral note that enhances the sweetness of the pastries.

The ambiance of Decadent Desserts and Tasty Tea adds to the overall experience. The elegant decor and soothing background music create a relaxed atmosphere, ideal for enjoying a leisurely afternoon. The staff is attentive and knowledgeable, offering excellent recommendations based on your preferences.

In summary, Decadent Desserts and Tasty Tea is a must-visit for dessert aficionados and tea enthusiasts alike. With its exquisite offerings and inviting atmosphere, it's a place where every visit feels like a special occasion.

Had a fun afternoon here with friends.   Food looked amazing.  I didn't have many options due to food allergies.  Personally, I feel like the people taking orders weren't too sure on allergies, but they did attempt to ask the chefs for me.  I ended up getting a broccoli salad and rice crispy treat.   It gets very busy, and you'll wait in a line to order your food.  Plan on it taking a while.

The atmosphere was absolutely beautiful.  I love how it's set in a vintage style home.  It reminded me of my grandparents home with the old school furniture and design.  The only negative was there was a rogue fly which can be annoying waving them off.  The tea was great and so was the cake by the slice!

I drove 2 hours and 30 minutes with a group of friends just to visit A cause for tea. The atmosphere was amazing and every staff member we interacted with as soon as we walked in till the end of our visit were very kind and welcoming! The tea, food & desserts were really good! 10/10 recommend
Fun and I enjoyed how the restaurant was set up.
I had the green bean casserole quiche. Delicious!!!  Went on a hot day so it was very warm inside. Can't wait to go in the fall and around Christmas.

Amazing place to eat. Immaculate decor, exceptional service, and freshly and deliciously prepared food. The tea selection is large and extremely good. You can have your teas prepared in 4 different ways which is explained in the menu. Lost of freshly made pastries too.

Celebrated my daughter's birthday with a few friends and family at this adorable tea gem. It was an amazing experience and was everything we thought it would be. Upon arrival the grounds were aesthetically appealing and immediately you became relaxed. The variety of rooms had various themes and so many details to view. We selected the porch although it was quite warm it  was the best way to accommodate our needs. The various teas and the variety of ways they are served is a refreshing way to start your experience. They have menu items that complement every taste. The pricing was surprisingly wonderful for the quality and pleasing table placement. This place pays attention to details that completely the entire visit.
Our service staff were excellent and the cashier was patient, polite and very helpful.
We ventured into the gift shop before leaving and was instantly impressed with the vintage items as well as the beautiful tea gifts.
I strongly suggest that if you love intimate cozy places with rich nostalgia you must visit this place.

Wonderful place!
We had an avocado toast and a slice of butter cake. Delicious and good price too.
Ladies were very helpful and kind.

Too bad I'm not from around here otherwise I'd be a frequent visitor!
The food is delicious and there are so many teas to choose from. I highly recommend this place.
What a beautiful gem this place is. The tea and food is delightful. And the atmosphere is spectacular. My friends and I went there for a Bridgerton tea day!

Atmosphere/ambience is spectacular. Feels like I am in a Bridgerton house for a tea. As the name suggests, tea is the main. They have lot of varieties, for the first time visitors like me, takes long time to decide.

Once I enter, the table is assigned and they give the menu. Once we have decided what to order, we go to the order counter in person, order and pay for it and then they take the orders to the table.

Food was delicious, service is excellent. Our daughter was very happy with the lemonade in her tea pot. Overall the experience was fantastic.
Awesome place for tea and relaxation.
Great local find and great food! Surprised we don't find it sooner! Would recommend as a local or to bring someone from out of town!

The atmosphere of this place is charming. If you're looking for a place to chat and hang out while feeling a little fancy, this is the perfect place. There are a variety of flavors of teas to try as well as the choice for many of their teas to be made in different ways. The food that they offer is also as tasty as their teas, especially their pastries.

The cherry festival tea was delightful and the chicken pie! I couldn't get over how piping hot it was when they served it. Quite good! Such a charming place for lunch, brunch or girls day. I'm definitely going back to try more teas soon!
Wonderful

I love A Cause For Tea! Not only do they have an incredible assortment of delicious teas and pastries but they also serve a higher purpose. From their website- "A Cause For Tea exists to globally empower women and children, demonstrating God's love one teacup at a time." Today I had a London Fog and strawberry scone and both were phenomenal.

Great tea house. The food was good. I love the three different savory biscuits. Strawberry tart was just right, not too sweet which I loved. Ordered cold Last Mango in Paris tea and it was phenomenal. Wish the biscuit came out hot, but otherwise it was good especially the sweet potato biscuit. Chicken on Holiday is a must try but if given choice it would be nice to pair with some crackers or toasted bruschetta. I would like to see them incorporate mango in their desserts especially they're in the season. Definitely recommend this place. Came at 9:30am and ate on the porch and was perfect weather. By time we finish which was 11:30am, the place was packed. A nice gem in the heart of Monroe.

We lunched at this quaint, feminine teahouse. My hot tea was so delicious we each bought some for home. We loved both our lunch and dessert. Browsed the cute little gift shop after lunch. Can't wait to return.

What a wonderful way to spend the morning with my dear friends Winter @wshanck and Nia @kimchi.and.collards at "A Cause for Tea" @acausefortea

"A Cause for Tea aspires to globally empower women and children by demonstrating God's love one teacup at a time."

This is a place with an inspirational cause and vision.

I had a lovely time at A Cause for Tea

#acausefortea #teatime #traveling
#teatimemagazine #monroenc #ontheroad #travelphotography #traveldestination
#ontheroadagain #christiancauses #causes

Very cute place with absolutely fantastic tea, but...

The ordering process is overwhelming, chaotic, and slow. Standing in line (for quite a while) while dodging the wait staff who are using the same hallway for food delivery and dodging people trying to get in and out of the bathrooms being blocked by the line (while in a cramped space with loud music) is just not the relaxing vibe you want with your tea.

Problems with menu/inventory: I ordered the baked brie, but they didn't have it. I tried for the chicken pie, but they didn't have it. Finally ordered soup when I was given the 3 options of what they did still have. Not what I wanted, but it was okay. (We were there hours before closing, so that wasn't the problem.)

Also, a lot of small problems...no spoons given with soup, scone was freakishly dry (but still good flavor), wasp's nest on porch, etc. My husband and I had to *share a spoon* because no one could/would track another one down for us.

The tea was good and the atmosphere was cute, so I would give them another try...maybe it was just an off day.

A cause for concern if you order take out. The sandwich was awesome and the pasta salad literally left something to be desired. The container was1/3 full with a grand total of 10 bow tie pasta noodles; what a ripoff, that's 50 cents per noodle.
What a wonderful spot for a cup of tea and good company. The food and tea were amazing as well as the welcoming atmosphere.

Everything here was delicious. We had the baked brie, a sweets sampler, carrot cake, chicken pot pie, and a pot of Golden Charm tea. All excellent. We ended up buying a tin of Golden Charm from their gift shop as well as Biblical lullaby book, perfect for our baby on the way. The building itself is beautifully kept. I am personally a fan of the way they displayed all the antiques around the historic house. My wife really loved going here for her Birthday. Thank you for making it a great experience.
A friend took me here for my birthday lunch. It was fabulous! The food & atmosphere was great & the service and politeness of the entire staff was top notch!!!
Quaint teahouse/store, excellent service, and delicious treats! Their scones are amazing! They seem to melt in your mouth! The tea sandwiches are also amazing. Great variety!

Place is beautiful.  Unfortunately food is not great.  My eggs benedict came in hour later, was over cooked and cold-- and I could see server knew my food was late. Our scones were raw inside. Would not go there for food second time.  I was looking forward trying this place and unfortunately it did disappoint.

I absolutely love this place! The historic building is beautiful and decorated very thoughtfully. It reminds me so very much of the historic homes in Charleston, SC. The atmosphere is welcoming and joyful. The gift shop offers many wonderful items and is fun to look around in. The service is welcoming, kind, thoughtful and attentive. Enjoying a cup of tea here is a delightful experience every time. Their only weak point is the food. The food looks great and is presented well, but lacks quality, flavor and consistency. Also, whatever you do, do not order the hot cocoa in the colder months, it tastes like low quality store brand hot cocoa mixed with too much hot water and too little cocoa. But, please do visit this establishment and enjoy a cup of tea and browse the gift shop. It really is a lovely experience!

What a beautiful and wonderful place for tea, brunch or a sweet treat!   They were extremely helpful and had many options for allergy issues.    Make sure to have time to spend in their gift shop too!   Not only for the tea and sweets you can take home but for the accessories and other gift items.
Absolutely beautiful...atmosphere, food, decor, and gift shop. Trust me, you will love it. Great place to meet up with friends or celebrate a milestone.
I love, love, love this place! Gorgeous gardens, very helpful staff and an A-1 treat!
Adorable
Great brunch, tea, and service.
Jessica was amazing!!
It was an incredible experience. Everyone is so nice and Ground 40 coming in giving everyone  roses made it even more special. The food was DELICIOUS ! We will definitely be back.
Very nice tea house that won't break the bank and they donate $$ to Nicaragua, Mexico, and other parts of Central America
The cutest place for a lunch with friends or a special occasion. The group party rooms upstairs are adorable. My 4 year old had a great time and there was plenty that she would eat.

Very disappointed. This is a far cry from a traditional afternoon tea experience.

From the onset, we were confused about the ordering process as we expected to be seated & to have a server come to take our order in the usual order. However, we were ushered down a narrow hallway to a delicatessen-styled room where we were handed menus & instructed to place our orders with the clerk. After doing so, and paying, we were handed a table number card and instructed to wander about and find an available table. We were starting to feel as though we were in an overly decorated-Starbucks and not tea establishment at all.
Once we found an available table, it took some time for our food to arrive. Our scones & pots arrived first and we asked our waiter for the steeping time & a saucer to remove & dispose the tea bags. He looked at us completely confused but did wander off to find a saucer, but was baffled over our initial question.
Next we received the sandwiches which were an overall disappointment. They were nothing special and very bland.
The scones were massive but were hard, dry, and crunchy! Crunchy scones! They did come with an assortment of condiments: Whipped cream, lemon curd, whipped butter, and jam, but only a teaspoon of each was offered for such a massive scone, and there certainly was not enough platted for two people to share. By the way, real Clotted Cream, or Devonshire cream is not available, instead, we were provided with a thin, watery whipped cream that quickly melted into a puddle
Lastly, we sampled the pea salad, which again was terrible. This reminded me of the seven layer salad that my mother used to make long ago at family gatherings.
On a positive note, I will say that the establishment is beautifully decorated, and I adored the theme of English meets Orient. The decor, wallpaper, and furnishings were artfully chosen and displayed; Its obvious a lot of attention and money went into the decor. I only wish they had just put as much effort into the food also.
Not returning.
I've been three times now, and every time the food has been delicious and the overall experience has been so fun. I highly recommend!
Very cozy

This place is a *gem*! So cute, delicious food, amazing tea, and an adorable, cozy atmosphere. I spent nearly 3 hours here chatting with girlfriends over tea and treats.

Their buttermilk scones, macarons, and lemon squares were all incredible!
The experience is Amazing

We came this morning as my cousin is getting married and planned to ask my daughters to be her flower girls. She had
bought pre-packaged/wrapped cookies that said "will you be my flower girl" on them. A blonde server walked by us first with a look of disdain on her face as we waited in line to place our breakfast/tea order. She came back and asked us if we had cookies and told us we could not have "outside food" as if we had brought  a package of Oreos or McDonald's into the restaurant. We clearly planned to order food  there and the cookies were wrapped in a clear box as a parting gift for my children. Her tone was rude and unwelcoming so we left. I have worked in the food industry many years and while the lady may have thought she was doing her job, there could have been a kinder approach. It honestly just felt like she wanted to get rid of us as we had 7 people. It wasn't like we planned to sit and take up a whole table while we munched on our cookies. Also if you are going to be that peculiar, you might want to work on your 93 sanitation score. I do want to add that the gentleman/host up front was very kind but it went sour fast.
Simply adorable! Food was delicious. Room for a large group of a few people.  With tables to relax throughout the property really felt like you were at a family gathering.
A really nice experience with my new friend. The house is beautiful.  The food was good and the tea selection is good. It was quiet and the service was good. They have a really cute gift shop.
This was my first time visiting this lovely location. The staff was so wonderfully friendly; the tea selection was overwhelming but great. Will return again.

Place by far exceed my expectations.  The food was amazing!!! The place was set up very well with unique decor. There is inside and outside dining.  We sat outside at one of their very unique tables.  I can't say enough about this place. It's a must-see.

This lovely Victorian house is beautiful and serves a great purpose. I had the buttermilk scone with butter and jam and it was so delicious! The staff is friendly and welcoming and the house is absolutely charming.

Such a cool and unique place to enjoy tea and company. Clearly the tea is king, as are the desserts. The food is really good, I'd give it 5 stars if the sides had no meat in them. They have a pea salad, as odd as that may sound, that is amazing, as well as the quiches. There's a tea of the day, a soup of the day, a quiche of the day. I go straight to the scones, or brownies, or the huge rice crispy treats!
There's a gift shop in this antique manor that has some awesome things.
Lastly, a Cause For Tea gives back to the community!
Love, love, love!! Definitely recommend this place if you are a tea lover. Great tea, great food, and great environment! Love the tea sandwiches!
The food is delicious. The service is excellent. Please be patient. They have a small staff and there can be a wait. It's worth it. A great place to catch up with a friend while enjoying tea.
A bit of Southern charm. Going again next week with daughter

Such a charming place. The Christmas theme, different wallpapers in every room, cozy decorations and mismatched tea sets. The price is fair and everyone we met working there was very kind. We'll be returning again for an afternoon date

I purchased tickets for the "Christmas Tea Time" as part of my Mom's Christmas gift. It was our first time at the tea house but it definitely won't be our last. Everything was amazing....the ambience, the friendly staff, the decor (even the bathroom is adorable!), the gift shop, the savory food, the sweets and of course, the tea. Do yourself a favor and go check this place out!
Beautiful!
Excellent!! If you go for breakfast try the avocado toast with poached egg.

A cause for tea is exactly the place that was missing for ladies of all ages! It's is so beautiful, inside and out, full of that beautiful charm that is so fresh seen anymore. Delicious tea and desserts! Our girls love it so much and I will make any excuse to visit  the Brie plate is so delicious. I will say that the chicken pot pie could use a little extra love, it was a bit too liquidy and acidic. Aside from that we've enjoyed everything. The foggy has been the favorite drink.

Cute spot and my daughter's absolutely love it.  Gives them a cause for dressing up for tea. We got the $18 croissant that's filled with Brie, The croissant was delicious the cheese was way too much, the ratio was off and made it the inside for sure it needed more jam. Overall it's not something I would do often, especially without cramped it is when it's cold there's hardly any seating. Servers constantly walk past you while you're ordering in a really tight space very awkward. The staff was really nice but once they drop off food or tea not check on you as often as you think especially if it's busy. We did get refills couple times but nobody asked how the food was.
First great restaurant/ cafe in Monroe! Well since atleast stone table closed!

This place is amazing! So quaint and such an awesome tea experience. I went for their special Christmas tea time, and the tea options were all Christmas themed. I tried two, a gingerbread one and a cinnamon one, both were so delish. All the pastries and desserts were just as yummy too. And the two waitresses were absolutely outstanding. So friendly and attentive. The location is beautiful, in an old house and upstairs are multiple rooms to have more intimate tea experiences. Downstairs is more open. I can't recommend this place enough, and believe me I will be back again and again and again!

I'm completely stunned by how amazing this establishment is. It took quite a while to order our food, but only because it was peak time AND they are extremely popular. They are popular for good reason, though. The wait meant absolutely nothing by the time our food and drinks came out; the tea was a delight and the food exceeded my already high expectations. The staff was very kind and helpful, as well. I definitely recommend this house if you want to have a special occasion, simply grab some tea and a macaron, and help out a lovely charity in the meantime!

Best kept secret in Monroe! It's everything you'd expect and more. The perfect place to relax with a hot cup of tea and some delicious food. The only thing that would make it better is if they had more rooibos tea options for those like myself who can't have caffeine. Would love to see some of the seasonal blends in a decaf version!
What a sweet place. Yummy tea, great souvenirs, holiday vibes, and friendship gathering goodness. A truly blessed place.

This was the cutest Tea House.  When you walk inside it is fully loaded with the cutest decorations especially for Christmas.  It was crowded for a Thursday at 1:00pm.

You order up front, we'll when you get into that room, be prepared as you will want to order 1 of everything as it all looked amazing. You pay when you order and they give you a table number.  We we found the perfect spot and our lunch was brought out.  We had soup, chicken salad sandwich and goodies!  We sat for hours just talking the time away.

I cannot wait to go back again as I can see already that I am going to become a regular patron.

This really is a special place. The options are endless.  As there are many gluten-free choices.  However, upon my first visit there, I ordered a salad, or I asked what the ingredients were. When the salad arrived, it had bacon in it, which I am a vegetarian and do not eat. Nor was I told that there was bacon in a salad. They fixed it right away. I just wish communication would've been correct when I ordered. Then I went back the second day to pick up a bunch of treats for my daughter's birthday. I took them home and gave them to her later. One of the treats was very bad.  I then had to drive it back to get her some thing she could enjoy. We definitely will return because I love the atmosphere, the food options and the cause behind this small business.  But I truly hope we will have a better experience next time.
Even the ceiling is decorated! This place was a wonderland. I felt like a kid! The staff was so kind and polite. The food GREAT and the tea. DREAMY!

First time at a tea house. It's so cute. Great service! The teas are amazing. I had never tried chicken pot pie, and it was so delicious. I can't wait to go back and eat it again. Definitely bought a few teas at the gift shop to enjoy at home.
Everything was amazing! Definitely recommend. They had great gluten free options that I loved, food and dessert. Just fantastic.
Amazing atmosphere, food and tea. This place is a Gem

I had such a lovely time here! The whole place have an Alice in the wonderland kinda vibes :) Plus it wasn't that busy when we went so we went so a small couch area which was super cute! Andy ways I def recommend the cucumber sandwiches, lavender macaroons, brownies, sugar cookies, scones, and ofc the tea! We got a seasonal one which had some orange cinnomen something I think but I rly loved it :)
We absolutely loved everything about A Cause for Tea. We're about an hour away but will be back again! Highly recommend!

The food here, never disappoints. I honestly cannot pick a favorite food item everything I have tried has been spot on. This is my new favorite spot to bring friends, family, or just go and relax myself. I highly recommend this tea house for your next breakfast, tea party, brunch, lunch, baby shower, bridal shower, etc. They also have special events that they sell tickets for which are worth the ticket price.

Great place to get some tea and something to eat whether it's a sandwich, snacks or sweets. The atmosphere is really great, I love the older style of the whole place. It's a great place to visit at least once.

This place was amazing! The food and baked goods were soooo delicious. The service was amazing and the atmosphere was incredible. I love what they support and their prices were pretty great imo. 100% recommend.
My biscuits were to hard for my taste.

Such a cute place! Great atmosphere! Staff is super sweet and friendly!
The only things I would change, egg salad was very dry and could be creamier  and the tea sandwiches would be nice to have a different bread than white bread.

My mother, daughter, and I came here for lunch and tea. What a beautiful place and wonderfully relaxing experience. Finally, a place in our area that transports you to another era without breaking the bank. We shared the baked brie with fruit, assorted tea sandwiches, a lemon bar, spice cake and (of course) a pot of tea. We will be back : )
I adore this place. Beautiful, relaxing, a great cause. Couldn't have been happier with my experience.

My husband and I took my 11 month old nephew to visit for the first time and we were blown away with the entire experience. After moving here from Lake Norman and desperately seeking nice places to go in Monroe ......we are so thankful that we have finally found a perfect little spot for afternoon tea! We will surely spread the news and return soon!
Very friendly staff and tasty treats.
Incredible experience every time! A must-visit in Monroe.
This place is absolutely adorable!

A beautifully decorated a house, tea pot, tea cups and saucers. It was angelic and worthy of a 5. Behind the counter service I think she was having an off day. No traditional scones to go with the delicious and perfectly served tea. Sometimes simple is best..gift shop extremely over priced..

Absolutely loved the theme and vibe of this place! If you're looking for an excuse to dressing up and going for a quant tea outing, I highly suggest planning a visit. I really appreciate the attention to detail from the decor to the cute swan cream puffs.
I think it should also be said that Alyssa was incredible and really brought the whole experience together. Treat yourself and go visit this place, you will not regret it!
Beautiful setting and great food, desserts and teas.  You need to check it out.

Being hugged by an angel, mom's apple pie, fragrances of lilac, lilies and love with cinnamon, rolled into one, best describes the warmth, serenity and genteel ambience of "A Cause for Tea".
Every room, each wall, table, chair, teapot and cup is eclectic and unique. "ACFT" made me feel special and any minute I thought Fraulein Maria and Queen Elizabeth would join me. It is a way from the contemporary hustle and bustle and technical maze in which we navigate. Whether having a spot of tea with a decadent scone or hosting a tea, or lunch with a friend,  be prepared to be transformed,  treated with tenderness and teased by desserts, entrees  that please and perform and are simply, works of art. Your napkins are cotton handkerchiefs that compliment table cloths. While, not required, appropriate apparel sets the tone for a wonderful experience, maybe even a fascinator and gloves if you like. Supports a good cause. I will be a regular. Thank you for gracing us with your gifts, which in turn empower women and children to live and lead independent, self-sufficient lives, serving others.

What a lovely place for a tea lunch. The food was delicious, the tea was wonderful, and the shop was delightful. And, knowing that the proceeds go to charity is the perfect ending for the afternoon. I highly recommend A Cause for Tea.
Loved it here! Can't wait to return for tea.

My first experience with an actual tea house! I was blown away by the old style Victorian house redesigned into this business. Every staff member was extremely kind. I was visiting from the Syracuse, NY area and my expectations were exceeded. I had the pleasure of trying the Chicken on Holiday which was delightful, tasty, and filled with flavor. A must try! Alyssa was our server and was kind and helpful all around  lots of indoor/outdoor seating available for a nice morning get together with friends and family. Please check them out! Overall the staff were very kind, I will be back on my next visit!
very good service, great place to relax and take beautiful pictures. My daughter loved it, we bought a book too.

What a lovely place! The only thing to be aware of is that the options for gluten and dairy sensitive people are limited, but available. Otherwise , everything is delicious, the tea wonderful, and the ambiance is quintessentially southern and beautiful. A wonderful place to feel either gussied up or causal with some friends over a cuppa.

Amazing place with a bunch of tea options, very provance styled and cozy! I loved the avocado toast and my hubby soup. I wish there could be more places around like this one

One small thing though - it can smell a bit like an old house inside

My friend and I love to try different places for lunch in the summertime. A Cause for Tea is a place that just makes you happy. You can try a variety of sweet and savory options along with different teas served a plethora of ways. Today I chose the cherry almond tea iced sweetened. My friend and I ordered a bunch of items to share and everything was delicious. Our least favorite selection was the tea biscuits. They weren't bad, just not spectacular. My favorite items were the strawberry pretzel salad, the cucumber sandwich, tomato pie, and the cheese ball platter with crackers. Will definitely be frequenting this location for special occasions and girls days.

Came here for the first time to check it out. Love this place and service was great. Decor was awesome and very peaceful environment. Food was great. Great place to enjoy cup of tea and take pictures. Will definitely come back again.
Fabulous!! Just fabulous!!! We enjoyed every aspect of our time there!! It's our new favorite place!! We will be back and we will bring others!!!
Love this place and the cause! Everyone is super friendly, Love the atmosphere, decor, food, tea...

A Cause for Tea is a one of a kind experience. It combines the tradition of an English tea house with Southern charm. The food, atmosphere, and people were just wonderful. I highly recommend trying it out.

Charming, historic, and gorgeous location for tea, breakfast, brunch, or lunch! I have been a few times now, and every single thing I have ordered has been so fresh and delicious. My husband also agreed the food was delicious and filling. Good portion sizes and wonderful options on their menu. There is something here for everyone! A "high tea" atmosphere that is cozy and casual enough to attend every weekend. Highly recommend as a relaxing spot to have tea, lunching with friends, a special date, or truly any occasion. When is it ever a bad time for tea? And the proceeds go to a good cause, which makes it just about perfect.

The most adorable tea house. We all throughly enjoyed every detail that was put into this vision. What a gem in Monroe. The peach scones with clotted cream and lemon curd was perfection and tea was in giant cups - like Alice in Wonderland. We will definitely be back!

Ample parking in the heart of historic Monroe this home is stunning and the staff were so awesome, friendly, and helpful. Lots of tea and yummy bites to eat. My 12 yr old granddaughter Loved it and said she felt so fancy. A must experience for sure.
This was such a nice experience.  Food, service and tea was exceptional.
Beautiful! My daughter loved the kids menu option, especially the little teapot and teacup for her lemonade. The food was delicious! I love the gift shop options of items from Nicaragua.
Food was delicious.

A small group of 5 ladies enjoyed our first experience here last week and WOW, it was delightful.  Everything about it was special, from the decor to the food and anything in between.  Service was friendly and fast, food was delicious with a variety of very filling tea-house style choices.  We ordered way too much food because everything sounded so good.  None of it disappointed. The mismatched china and crystal serving pieces were SO FUN!  What a treat.  It already seems very popular, so be prepared to wait awhile to order at the register.  Can't wait to go back!

Impeccable service unforgettable experience.

Where do I start?..
upon entering the house you submerge yourself in the 18th century atmosphere. The design of their cafe is very unique and you won't find it anywhere else.

Teas selection is huge. And the food is very tasty.Moreover, the service is impeccable .
There were misunderstanding at the cashier when I was placing my order. So they brought me a different tea not the one I ordered, however, a super nice woman left this tea and brought me my initial order.But not just that she brought me 2 more cups of  Tea to choose from so I ended up having three different kind of teas !!!! I love all of them and of course I was very impressed by the hospitality and the service.

I definitely will be a regular. I love this place uniqueness. I love the food and the service , so you definitely want to check it out and I'm sure you're gonna love it to
Such a beautiful and lovely place to have an afternoon tea or a birthday party. The atmosphere is so inviting and an amazing cause to support. We will be back
You must try the Duet, tea and coffee!
Simply fabulous! I cannot wait to return for their incredible blueberry scone!
Great place to stop for a mid-day snack or a lunch.  Good place to meet up with friends for lunch or tea time.
Celebrated Easter at the Tea house and we were absolutely stunned how beautiful everything was.
Everything was amazing; it was definitely a dining experience.  We will be returning!!!  Everyone was friendly, and your purchase supports their cause, empowering women and children.
Absolutely wonderful! Everything about it! Can't wait to come back in a couple of weeks!
Attended a special tea and everything was awesome.  Love the decor and the gift shop
Celebrated Easter at the Tea house and we were absolutely stunned how beautiful everything was. And the food was delicious. Can't wait to go back!

I love this ministry so much!! They have the most delicious teas and treats on top of the fact that they serve and give back to those in great need. If you don't know about A Cause for Tea and their beautiful mission it's time for you to check them out!! God has definitely blessed this ministry.
